name: Easy Spiced Basmati Pilaf
description: A mix of fennel seeds, cinnamon, and dry bay leaf perfumes this basmati rice pilaf, releasing a comforting, delicious aroma that lingers long after the dish is done. And even though the recipe itself is simple and quick, its elegance and complex flavor profile impresses my guests without fail.
recipeIngredient: 2 inch stick of cinnamon, broken roughly
3 cups water (the level of water should be an inch above the rice level)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a Heavy-bottomed [lidded] saucepan over medium heat until shimmering. Add onion and cook, stirring, until golden brown and soft, about 8 minutes. Add the sugar just when the onions start to caramelize to give the oil a nice brown. Reduce heat to medium-low. Add the bay leaves, cardamom, cinnamon, clove, and star anise and keep stirring until fragrant, about 5 minutes.

Add the fennel seeds and stir for 1 minute. Add the rice and stir carefully so that the rice doesn't stick to the pan. The oil will be tinged brown with the onions and this will coat the rice as you stir it. Stir for 1 minute. Add a pinch of salt and water and stir once. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to lowest setting, cover, and cook until the rice absorbs all the water, about 20 minutes. Serve.
